page.title: 19Springfield Gravel Pit
page.content: The development of the Springfield gravel pit is a major issue concerning Beaconsfield residents today. Despite public protest the plans were finally passed 6 years ago and digging started 4 years later. The site being excavated at this moment will be used for a gravel plant. The plans state that this must be erected 40 feet below ground level so as not to affect the landscape to a large degree. The extraction will destroy 4 surrounding fields, producing sand and gravel for 20 years, after which time the pit will be filled with rubbish and eventually restored to farmland. The controversy surrounding the pit concerns not only the effect of heavy lorries through Beaconfield and the dumping of rubbish but also the possible leakage of methane gas from decaying organic matter after infill.
